node.name: OpenSwing
node.shortdescription:
OpenSwing is an open source suite of Swing based graphics components.
These components include label control, multi-line label control, text field, text formatted field, multi-line text field, numeric field, currency field, calendar, grid, grid with nested grids, grid with nested Form, grid with generic nested components, properties grid, pivot table, tree, check-box tree, tree combined with a grid, lookup, gantt diagram, buttons with image, combo-box, combo-box multi-column, radio button, check-box, list, list multi-column, wizard panel, image panel, splash screen, dialog windows, tip of the day frame, progress bar/panel/dialog, licence agreement panel, alert window, iconifable window, "Outlook-like" panes, link button.

These graphics components are complaints with java bean specifications, so they can be used with the UI designer of Eclipse platform, such as Jigloo or Window Builder plugins.



OpenSwing provides support for data binding and POJO too.

Graphics components can be used to develop both rich client applications and rich internet applications.

They can be easily combined with the most popular server-side layers, such as Spring, Hibernate, Apache Cayenne, iBatis, JPA and comunication protocol could be HTTP or RMI (for EJB 3.0)
node.body:
OpenSwing is an open source suite of Swing based graphics components.
These components include label control, multi-line label control, text field, text formatted field, multi-line text field, numeric field, currency field, calendar, grid, grid with nested grids, grid with nested Form, grid with generic nested components, properties grid, pivot table, tree, check-box tree, tree combined with a grid, lookup, gantt diagram, buttons with image, combo-box, combo-box multi-column, radio button, check-box, list, list multi-column, wizard panel, image panel, splash screen, dialog windows, tip of the day frame, progress bar/panel/dialog, licence agreement panel, alert window, iconifable window, "Outlook-like" panes, link button.

These graphics components are complaints with java bean specifications, so they can be used with the UI designer of Eclipse platform, such as Jigloo or Window Builder plugins.



OpenSwing provides support for data binding and POJO too.

Graphics components can be used to develop both rich client applications and rich internet applications.

They can be easily combined with the most popular server-side layers, such as Spring, Hibernate, Apache Cayenne, iBatis, JPA and comunication protocol could be HTTP or RMI (for EJB 3.0)
